description: Shakshuka is a warming mixture of vegies, eggs and spices. Whip up these tomatoey baked eggs for a weekend brunch or special brekkie.
keywords: Shakshuka,Pescatarian,Low saturated fat,Seafood free,Low salt,Gluten free,Tree nut free,Low sugar,Sesame free,Mother's Day,Mushroom,Halal,High protein,High fibre,Christmas,Soy free,Wheat free,Vegetarian,Peanut free
name: Shakshuka Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Line a sieve with paper towel and sit over a bowl. Add Greek yoghurt and leave to strain for 2 hours.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic, mushrooms and capsicum. Cook, stirring often, until softened and golden. Stir in harissa and cumin.

Add tomato. Season. Bring mixture to the boil. Cook for 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Using a large spoon, make four indents in tomato mixture and break an egg into each. Cook for 15 minutes or until egg whites are cooked. Top with strained yoghurt and coriander. Season and serve.
